group_works.title: The Godless state
group_works.creator_credit: Michael Houlday, Michael Murphy and Granada Television International

results.title: The Godless state
results.creator_credit: Michael Houlday, Michael Murphy and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Christians”.
Traces the development of religious indifference and atheism from the French Revolution to the present. Focuses on the current state of religion in the Soviet Union, Poland, and Italy. However, makes the statement that with the New Testament there is no clear impression for readers about what Christianity stood for. The reader can glean from it any message that he/she wants…therefore Christianity has the ability to adapt.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Houlday, Michael Murphy and Granada Television International

group_works.title: Jamie, Ethan and Keir: 2-14 months
group_works.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Jamie, Ethan and Keir: 2-14 months
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Child”.
The world at toddler’s eye level. For months a baby lies in his crib looking at all those things just beyond his reach. Then he learns to move about, to crawl, to stand and suddenly all those things are his to touch, to taste. This film observes a baby’s natural curiosity, his way of “getting into things” as part of the experience of learning and adapting. Differences in behaviour of the three babies are noted.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: 4 years-6 years = Four years to six years
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Dorothy Courtois, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Child”.
By the age of four the child is curious about the world around him. To find out, he is asking thousands of questions. He is also learning not to be afraid. This film shows children in learning situations: on a nature hike; handling animals and other creatures; dealing with their peers. One particularly interesting example is that of Ingrid and Helen, twins who look alike but act differently.

results.title: Kathy and Ian: three-year-olds
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child”.
By the age of three children become aware of themselves as unique. This happens through their continuing interaction with parents, siblings and friends. This film explores these relationships and the resulting development within the child.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Debbie and Robert: 12-24 months (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Child”.
Debbie and Robert’s behaviour is typical of the second year of life. Illustrates the process of learning that goes on through every waking hour, and the kind of guidance a parent can give.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Changing Landscape”.
Charles Nancarrow, Wildlife Management Officer, shos the variety of land usage on the Islands of Westernport bay and its effect on the wildlife.
